Called Google Latitude, it can be added to Android and BlackBerry phones, phones running Windows Mobile 5.0 and up, and most Nokia smartphones running the Symbian operating system. An iPhone app is promised to follow soon.

docs.snippet: Google notified Time Warner that it wants out of its 5 percent investment in AOL....
docs.lead_paragraph: Measured strictly in terms of financial returns, Google's investment in AOL has been a dud. In 2005, Google paid $1 billion for a 5 percent stake in AOL, valuing the Time Warner unit at $20 billion. Last month, Google wrote down the value of that investment by $726 million, which assumes AOL's new valuation is $5.5 billion.

headline.main: Google Wants Out of AOL Investment

docs.snippet: A long-fought Mideast issue meets Google....
docs.lead_paragraph: Last Friday, Haaretz broke the news that for the last four years, the Israeli government has been compiling a database on Jewish settlements on the West Bank. The paper reports that the information - known as the Spiegel report, after the name of the Israeli general who led the effort - was gathered to enable the government "to contend with legal actions brought by Palestinian residents, human rights organizations and leftist movements challenging the legality of construction in the settlements and the use of private lands to establish or expand them."

headline.main: Mapping Israeli Settlements on the West Bank

docs.abstract: A long-fought Mideast issue meets Google.

docs.snippet: Lexicon | "Porkulus" is opponents' word for the economic stimulus bill now before Congress, a conflation of "pork" and "stimulus." A Nexis database search finds nearly 70 citations in major news sources since Jan. 28 and none before (with this leg...
docs.lead_paragraph: Lexicon | "Porkulus" is opponents' word for the economic stimulus bill now before Congress, a conflation of "pork" and "stimulus." A Nexis database search finds nearly 70 citations in major news sources since Jan. 28 and none before (with this legislative meaning). Google News shows a similar spike, especially this weekend. The word's currency is attributed to Rush Limbaugh: "On his show Wednesday [Jan. 28], Limbaugh called it the 'porkulus' package, for all the pork-barrel projects he saw in it." [San Francisco Chronicle, Jan. 29; Google]

headline.main: 'Porkulus'

docs.abstract: Lexicon | "Porkulus" is opponents' word for the economic stimulus bill now before Congress, a conflation of "pork" and "stimulus." A Nexis database search finds nearly 70 citations in major news sources since Jan. 28 and none before (with this legislative meaning). Google News shows a similar spike, especially this weekend. The word's currency is attributed to Rush Limbaugh: "On his show Wednesday [Jan. 28], Limbaugh called it the 'porkulus' package, for all the pork-barrel projects he saw in it." [San Francisco Chronicle, Jan. 29; Google]

docs.snippet: BEING DOUSED AT TI KWEN GLO CHO HOT SPRINGS, WOTTON WAVEN, DOMINICA,  DEC. 27  John-Francis Bourke, left,   a photographer from Brooklyn. ''My mom passed away last March, and since I usually go home to  Ireland to spend Christmas with her, I neede...
docs.lead_paragraph: BEING DOUSED AT TI KWEN GLO CHO HOT SPRINGS, WOTTON WAVEN, DOMINICA, DEC. 27 John-Francis Bourke, left, a photographer from Brooklyn. ''My mom passed away last March, and since I usually go home to Ireland to spend Christmas with her, I needed to do something totally different. So I Googled 'remote undeveloped Caribbean island,' and this is what I came up with -- honestly, true story. I've always traveled with friends or girlfriends who need to see everything, who really need to digest the destination. I found it all too tiring, because New York is so exhausting every day. I always fantasized about going somewhere where I could sit alone. So I did a lot of sitting in Dominica. At the springs, bamboo pipes channel the hot water from the side of the mountain into the cast-iron tubs. All the bathtubs are vintage -- probably not a word they use in Dominica -- but they're really ancient, I would imagine from old plantation homes or other old-style homes. The water has a bit of a metallic taste. I don't know if it's from the mineral salts or from the tub, I have really no clue.'' As told to Seth Kugel

headline.main: WHY WE TRAVEL

docs.abstract: Brooklyn photographer John-Francis Bourke comments on his visit to remote hot springs on Dominica; photo (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: Setting up an obvious battle with Google and another possible one with Apple in the fast-growing electronic-book business, Amazon.com on Monday introduced the Kindle 2, a new version of its popular e-book reader. The announcement strengthens the bid by Amazon for control of the e-book market and the devices consumers use to read them.

headline.main: Amazon Shows A New Version Of Its Kindle

docs.snippet: The leading search engines team up to eliminate duplicate URLs from the Web....
docs.lead_paragraph: In a rare instance of collaboration among otherwise fierce rivals, Google, Yahoo and Microsoft said Thursday that they would support a new Web standard that will allow millions of Web publishers to remove duplicate pages from their Web sites. As a result of the effort, search engines should be able to find and index more Web pages, making their search results more comprehensive.

headline.main: Google, Yahoo and Microsoft Collaborate to Clean Up Web

docs.snippet: Internet | One big infrastructure stimulus could be virtual, a blog says. In the name of transparency, all stimulus-spending data is supposed to be posted at a new government site, Recovery.gov. And such databases can "spawn new business and greas...
docs.lead_paragraph: Internet | One big infrastructure stimulus could be virtual, a blog says. In the name of transparency, all stimulus-spending data is supposed to be posted at a new government site, Recovery.gov. And such databases -- if truly accessible, especially via feeds like RSS and XML -- typically "spawn new business and grease the wheels of the economy," as when marketing firms slice and dice Census data and Google makes maps. [Portfolio]

headline.main: The Info Infrastructure Stimulus

docs.abstract: Internet | One big infrastructure stimulus could be virtual, a blog says. docs.lead_paragraph: Regular readers of the Frugal Traveler may recall my experiments with using GPS. Back in 2007, when I drove cross-country, I hung a Sony GPS-CS1KASP from my rearview mirror; it tracked my progress for 12,000 miles, recording every wrong turn and gas station stop with remarkable accuracy. (Zoom in deep to the cross-country Google map, and you'll see what I mean.)

headline.main: Photo Geo-Tagging on the Cheap

docs.lead_paragraph: A small Web site operator filed an antitrust suit against Google on Tuesday, accusing it of unfairly manipulating its advertising system to harm a potential competitor. TradeComet.com, which operates a site called SourceTool.com, a vertical search engine for those seeking business products and services, accused Google of raising the advertising rates it charged the company after it realized that SourceTool was a potential competitor.

headline.main: Lawsuit Says Google Was Unfair To Rival Site

docs.snippet: Internet | The future of Web journalism as seen by a Google senior vice president: "We won't (and shouldn't) try to stop the faceless scribes of drivel, but we can move them to the back row of the arena." [GoogleBlog]...
docs.lead_paragraph: Internet | The future of Web journalism as seen by a Google senior vice president (in an e-mail originally meant for internal consumption): "We won't (and shouldn't) try to stop the faceless scribes of drivel, but we can move them to the back row of the arena." But not "high-quality" content: "We need to make it easier for the experts, journalists, and editors that we actually trust to publish their work under an authorship model that is authenticated and extensible, and then to monetize in a meaningful way." [GoogleBlog]

docs.snippet: Google misses an opportunity with its Life magazine archive....
docs.lead_paragraph: My favorite way to look at photographs is by leafing through homemade albums. The captions are fanciful, the order is significant, the material is diverse. Good albums communicate a private urgency, and occasionally you even hit on something sinister, as when an ex-wife is conspicuously missing or a blacklisted face has been cropped out. For decades, a growing network of scrappers in America has refined and updated English commonplace books and turned scrapbooking into folk art.

headline.main: In the Magazine: Photo Negative

docs.abstract: Google misses an opportunity with its Life magazine archive.

byline.original: By MIGUEL HELFT and BRIAN STELTER

docs.snippet: Technology | Think logging onto your computer is a surrender of privacy? That's nothing. Wait'll you read what your cell phone does to it. It takes the monitoring of personal behavior from the checkerboard to 3-D chess. [Business Week]...
docs.lead_paragraph: Technology | Think booting up your computer is a surrender of privacy? That's nothing. Wait'll you read what your cell phone does to it. It takes the monitoring of personal behavior from the checkerboard to 3-D chess. "The phone in your hand is the bridge between the virtual and real worlds," says a honcho at Nokia, which with Google and others has embarked on pinpointing the movements and behaviors of millions of mobile-device users to map the long-awaited Next Net. [Business Week]

headline.main: Big Cell Is Watching

docs.abstract: Technology | Think logging onto your computer is a surrender of privacy? That's nothing. Wait'll you read what your cell phone does to it. It takes the monitoring of personal behavior from the checkerboard to 3-D chess. [Business Week]
